title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a correct explanation equivalent to the following.

· The time periods Δ  t 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D83@ and Δ  t 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D84@ correspond to the condensation and freezing of VrO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C83@ , respectively. The data imply that the enthalpy of vaporization of VrO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C83@ is greater than its enthalpy of fusion. As a result, more energy needs to be removed from the system, and correspondingly it takes a longer period of time, for VrO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C83@ to completely condense than to completely freeze.

The response provides a correct explanation equivalent to the following.

· The time periods Δ  t 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D83@ and Δ  t 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D84@ correspond to the condensation and freezing of VrO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C83@ , respectively. The data imply that the enthalpy of vaporization of VrO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C83@ is greater than its enthalpy of fusion. As a result, more energy needs to be removed from the system, and correspondingly it takes a longer period of time, for VrO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C83@ to completely condense than to completely freeze.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a correct explanation of the error equivalent to the following.

· The maximum of the dashed line should be to the right of the maximum of the solid line. According to kinetic molecular theory, the average speed of the molecules increases when the temperature increases.

The response provides a correct explanation of the error equivalent to the following.

· The maximum of the dashed line should be to the right of the maximum of the solid line. According to kinetic molecular theory, the average speed of the molecules increases when the temperature increases.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to one of the following.

· Less than. When the volume of the system decreases, Q<K MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaWGrbGaeyipaWJaam4saaaa@3BA5@ and the distribution of species shifts towards the product.

OR

· Less than. According to Le Châtelier’s principle, decreasing the volume of a gaseous equilibrium system will shift the distribution of species towards the side with the fewest number of gas particles. In this case, the shift favors the product.

The response provides both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to one of the following.

· Less than. When the volume of the system decreases, Q<K MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaWGrbGaeyipaWJaam4saaaa@3BA5@ and the distribution of species shifts towards the product.

OR

· Less than. According to Le Châtelier’s principle, decreasing the volume of a gaseous equilibrium system will shift the distribution of species towards the side with the fewest number of gas particles. In this case, the shift favors the product.
